intro: Peucedanum terebinthaceum subsp. aculeolatum, commonly known as the prickly cowparsley, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is found in mountainous regions of Europe. It has a taproot system and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its distinctive prickles on the stems and leaves help in identifying the species.
